content: 33 34 36 36 cm upper arm 12 1/4 13 1/4 14 1/4 15 1/4 16 17 3/4 19 1/4 20 1/2 / 31 34 36 39 41 45 49 52 cm yoke depth 9 1/4 9 3/4 10 1/4 10 3/4 11 1/4 11 3/4 12 1/4 12 3/4 / 23 25 26 27 29 30 31 32 cm pattern notes this is a circular yoke-necked pullover worked from the top down the body and sleeves are worked seamlessly in round to the base of the yoke then each worked separately in the round sleeve instructions are written to use dpns however an alternate method of working small cir- cumferences can be used such as magic-loop as yoke increases change to a longer circular nee- dle if adjusting the length of the sleeves or body the row in which the colours are changed may also need to be adjusted to keep the same colour block effect stitch guide ssk slip slip knit - single decrease slip two stitches knit-wise one at a time from left needle to right needle insert point of left needle into front of two slipped stitches and knit them together with the right needle 1 st decreased m1l make 1 stitch left leaning insert left needle from front to back under strand of yarn which runs between next st on left nee- dle and last st on right needle knit this st through back loop 1 st increased m1r make 1 stitch right leaning insert left needle from back to front under strand of yarn which runs between next st on left nee- dle and last st on right needle knit this st through front loop 1 st increased w&t wrap & turn slip next st to the right needle purl-wise take yarn to opposite side of work between needles slip same st back onto left needle purl-wise turn work ready to begin working in opposite direction concealing wrap on the knit side slip the right needle under the wrap and knit it together with the st that it wraps concealing wrap on the purl side with the right needle pick up the wrap from underneath on the opposite side and lift it up on to the left needle then purl it together with the st that it wraps 2 abbreviations begin back neck shaping bor beginning of round short-row 1 rs knit 41 42 43 48 49 50 51 decrease d decrease d 52 sts w&t dpns double pointed needles short-row 2 ws purl to bor marker sm increase d increase d purl 41 42 43 48 49 50 51 52 w&t short- k k knit row 3 rs slipping marker knit to 4 4 4 5 5 k2tog knit 2 stitches together decrease 5 5 5 sts from wrapped st w&t knit-wise insert needle into stitch as if to knit short-row 4 ws slipping marker purl to 4 it 4 4 5 5 5 5 5 sts from wrapped st w&t m1l see
